benchmark_details.name: RIMO (Remade International Mathematical Olympiad)
benchmark_details.overview: RIMO is a two-track benchmark designed to evaluate mathematical reasoning by reformulating International Mathematical Olympiad problems into a deterministic format. It consists of RIMO-N, with 335 problems that allow for exact answer checking, and RIMO-P, featuring 456 proof problems with guided sub-problems for step-by-step reasoning evaluation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a high-resolution benchmark for evaluating advanced mathematical reasoning capabilities of large language models.

data.source: International Mathematical Olympiad materials from 1959 to 2023
data.annotation: Problems curated and transformed by experts

methodology.calculation: Deterministic grading for RIMO-N based on a constant-time string match, and multi-step evaluation for RIMO-P.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better mathematical reasoning capabilities.
methodology.baseline_results: Scores of ten models, with the highest being 62.96% on RIMO-N.
methodology.validation: Results benchmarked against GSM8K and MATH datasets
